revised_title: English Kermes Insect and its Dye Properties
tldr: In this letter, Martin Lister discusses the hatching of the English Kermes insect and its potential use for dyeing. He describes the appearance and behavior of the insects, as well as the properties of the dye they produce. Lister also compares the English Kermes to the Scarlet-Kermes found in shops and concludes that both are created by the mother-bee for the nourishment of her young.
